Subscription.Description: Records when applications crash which could be indicative of exploitation
Subscription.Query: <QueryList> <!-- Catch application crashes See http://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/3116.event-id-1001-windows-error-reporting.aspx for more details on error reporting. --> <Query Id="0" Path="Application"> <Select Path="Application">*[System[Provider[@Name='Windows Error Reporting'] and (EventID=1001 or EventID=1002)]]</Select> <Suppress Path="Application"> *[EventData[Data[position()=3] = 'MpTelemetry' or Data[position()=3] = 'AEAPPINV2' or Data[position()=3] = 'AEAPPINVW8' or Data[position()=3] = 'WindowsUpdateFailure' or Data[position()=3] = 'WindowsUpdateFailure2' or Data[position()=3] = 'WindowsUpdateFailure3' or Data[position()=3] = 'ScriptedDiagFailure' or Data[position()=3] = 'NetworkDiagnosticsFrameworkV3' or Data[position()=3] = 'ShellBrowserCancel' or Data[position()=3] = 'VSSetup' or Data[position()=3] = 'AppxDeploymentFailureBlue' or Data[position()=3] = 'PnPDriverNotFound' or Data[position()=3] = 'PnPGenericDriverFound' or Data[position()=3] = 'RADAR_PRE_LEAK_64' or Data[position()=3] = 'PDUWICA' or Data[position()=3] = 'AppHangB1' ]] </Suppress> </Query> <Query Id="1" Path="Application"> <Select Path="Application">*[System[Provider[@Name='Windows Error Reporting'] and EventID=1000]]</Select> </Query> </QueryList>
